3. Important Directories¶

Most everything is kept in my home folder on the computer, C:\Users\christopher.mcgee\. The notable exception to this is C:\Product Templates (Master)\ which, unsurprisingly, contains all Illustrator and InDesign master templates.

3.1. Home directory¶

Most of the files and directories here are just for storing software preferences and can thus be ignored. The three notable exceptions are ~\dev\, ~\Sites\, and ~\Documents\.

3.2. Dev¶

In here are most of my development projects and helpers. I had planned to incorporate ~\Sites\ in here at some point, but that always got postponed.

Note

I have a similar directory under WSL: ~/dev/. I think I had copied one to the other at some point. In any case, the two have now diverged, but they still share many directories. Thus, there is some confusion as to which has the ‘proper’ version of those duplicated directories. Unfortunately, I cannot answer that.

Here is what you can find under ~\dev\.

Directory

Purpose

eclipse-workspace

DEPRECATED. This is where all of the old, original Eclipse workspaces live.

Icons

Where the icons used for Sky Schedule and Sky Launcher live.

Learning

Cloned repositories associated with tutorial videos and documents.

projects

Main folder of my coding projects as well as tests and experiments.

reference

Files and repositories that I use as references on my projects.

Text Files

Customized text files (and more) from Quikey. Used for testing purposes.

Tools

Various tools downloaded or cloned that are necessary for some of my projects.

All other directories are probably just temporary or old and no longer necessary.

3.3. Sites¶

As it says on the tin, this directory contains the various web sites and apps that I manage. Most of the directories should be self-explanatory, but a few do require some explanation:

Directory Name

Purpose

++Certificates

Contains the latest SSL certificates that Shawn purchases for all of our sites.

++Purchases

Downloads of purchased software packages that I use for some of our sites. Mostly just backup.

++WordPress

More downloads of purchases, this time for our upcoming AA WordPress site.

aa2021

Old, static HTML/CSS American Accents site.

aa2021-assets

Static assets for the new WordPress AA site.

The remainder of the files in this directory are probably of no consequence and can be deleted.

3.4. Documents¶

This is where a great deal of my work is done. Some directories are just defaults that are created automatically and managed by their respective software and some others require their own subsection to explain, but most can be summed up in this table:

Directory

Purpose

1Password*.1pif

Has all the login credentials I use at Sky in 1Password format.

adobe-scripts

Explained in Template-Making Scripts and in further detail below.

Bluehost

Some invoices from our failed attempted to use Bluehost as our website host.

db-backup

For storing backups of our various databases. It’s rather disorganized, sorry.

employee test folder

For potential Art Department employees.

JavaScript Native[…]

Course by Davide Barranca for creating native applications for Photoshop. Probably deprecated by now.

ShareX

Stores screenshots and screencaptures made with ShareX.

SyncBackFree Profiles

Backups of the profiles (tasks) used in SyncBackFree.

temp

Used primarily for making InDesign templates.

The other directories are created by software and you can find out more about them by researching their software.

Files:

File Name

Purpose

1Password*.csv

Has all the login credentials I use at Sky in CSV format.

2020 American Accents Catalog.pdf

These are symlinks/shortcuts to server files for quick and easy access.

AA Gross & Net Pricing.lnk

Absence request form.pdf

Item #.lnk

Item Specifications.lnk

MailingBoxes-PiecesPerSheet.pdf

Adobe*.ps1

PowerShell scripts to manage Adobe Updates.

AEM-Sites-Buyers-Guide.pdf

Adobe guide on how to pick the best content manager service.

Allworx9224doc.pdf

Instructions for the phone system.

CheatSheet-TissuePaper.pdf

Instructions for how to Proof a Tissue Paper job.

clip.exe

Used to copy WSL things to the Windows clipboard.

colortest.ps1

A test to see how colors appear on PowerShell.

D-BSL-SMOOTH

Backup of a deprecated item, the Smooth Beverage Sleeve.

Delete_Job.sql

Template for deleting an Order from the sky_schedule database.

FindLineItemsWithoutOrders.sql

SQL script to find any orphaned Line Items in the db.

Get_All_By_Job_Id.sql

DEPRECATED. To get all the info from the db on a given Order.

get_line_item_and_artworks_by_order_id.sql

Same as above, but leaves out the Order info.

GetAllByJobNumber.sql

To get all the info from the db on a given Order.

Free Space.xlsx

A calculator for seeing when the server would run out of disk space.

IT Cheat Sheet.xlsx

OUTDATED. A very old version of a list of all computers and their logins.

ItemID_2019_v10.xlsx

A scratch board for testing out what Product Numbers would look like.

P26208 - Exile

PO for the Exile (imagesetter) software upgrade.

PCs-*.txt

List of PCs that are used by psshutdown to, well, shut down those PCs.

PrepCenter-Instructions-PC.pdf

Instructions on how to use PrepCenter on Windows.

RegExp-01 - Tables to Divs.txt

Copy-paste-able Regular Expressions to convert the old table-style thumbnails to the newer div-style thumbnails on the old static AA site.

skyfs.rdp

Remote Desktop connection to SKYFS.

vscode-user-settings.json

Backup of user settings I made before wiping VS Code.

White-Ink-Examples.pdf

Instructions on how to properly handle white ink.

WinSCP.ini

Backup of FTP sites used in WinSCP.

3.4.1. adobe-scripts¶

Many scripts that I have developed in the past for testing purposes or for some automated workflows (besides the main Proof and Output scripts) are found here in ~\Documents\adobe-scripts\. Most of them are old, outdated, and not very well organized. You’ll probably only ever use the three mentioned above, but I kept everything here just in case you may need them.

Directory Name

Purpose

Acrobat

Contains the main 6 Acrobat scripts that are used in the Proof/Output scripts.

IllustratorDownloaded

A bunch of Illustrator scripts that I’ve downloaded which I thought might be useful.

IllustratorLearning

Where all of my small unit tests are made before they are incorporated into larger scripts.

Illustrator++LargestPathArea

One of two useful scripts for Illustrator for shaped products.

Illustrator++ResizeToArea

The second of those useful scripts.

Illustrator[the rest]

Everything else are mostly just tests and experiments.

InDesigncreate-downloadable-*

See the above section for more info. These are used often.

InDesignLearning

Like with Illustrator, small tests done in here so I can learn.

InDesign[the rest]

The rest are smaller scripts and experiments that are used rarely, if at all anymore.

Photoshop

Two experiments for batch renaming layers and for creating a @1.5x version of retina files.

3.5. sky-open-template¶

One dev project that doesn’t exist in ~\dev\ is sky-open-template. This can be found at C:Program Files (x86)Common FilesAdobeCEPextensionscom.skyunlimitedinc.open-template. This is the CEP project for easily opening templates in Illustrator. This will need to be updated every time a new major version of Illustrator is released.
